segments.text: I see that there are Olympic mascots in your car .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . I am very interested in the Olympic Games , and I'm especially excited about 2008 Beijing Olympics .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Me , too . I want to be a volunteer for 2008 Beijing Olympics .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's cool . Care for a little quiz on that ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No problem . I'm an ' Olympic expert ' .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Wow , you've talked the talk . Now it's time to walk the walk . Here we go . First , can you tell me something about the ancient Olympics ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The ancient Olympics originated in ancient Greece .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Good . Why do people name it Olympics ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: They name it after the place where it was first held .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: This question is a piece of cake . A Frenchman named Baron de Coubertin .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Of course he was called ' the father of the Olympics ' .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What did he do for restoring the Olympics ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: He once made a speech on the â€˜ Renaissance of the Olympics ' .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I've told you I'm an expert .
segments.speaker: S1
